page.title: 09METHODISM BISHOP SUTTON
page.content: A strong Methodist tradition exists in Bishop Sutton and has done so for over 200 years. At present there are two buildings connected by a corridor. The old church is now the church hall and the newer building is the sanctuary . The minister is the Revd. C.J.Fellows, and the membership of 43 is growing. The community role extends beyond that to include a further 80 residents.Two services are held each sunday, one at 11.00am and the other at 6.00pm.with communion services at least twice every quarter. The first Sunday in each month sees a United Family Service, which alternates its venue between the two churches in the village.The church enjoys a lively fellowship and is at present raising a target of Â£4000 to finance rewiring in the church and replacing the floor of the hall.
